fields.headline: News in brief
fields.bodyText: Far East incentive Adventure operator Exodus is knocking £100 off holidays to Sri Lanka to help encourage holidaymakers back to the country following the tsunami. Exodus is offering a number of trips including a 15-day tour that has been reduced to £998 from £1,098. exodus.co.uk Capital idea If you're stuck for ideas on how to fill the looming Easter holidays, take a look at Kids Love London, a newly-revamped website brimming with ways of keeping your little ones occupied. Suggestions include the Colonel Blood and Great Crown Jewels Robbery at the Tower of London, Easter Egg Hunt at the Imperial War Museum, and the London Harness Horse Parade in Battersea Park. kidslovelondon.com Family adventure Peregrine Adventures is the latest adventure specialist to introduce holidays specifically for families. The operator is offering trips to China, Vietnam, South Africa, India and Egypt. A 12-day Mummies and Pharaohs itinerary costs from £600pp, excluding flights. peregrineadventures.co.uk Med for it Sardinia specialist Sardatur is offering a special flat rate of £305 for 12 to 17-year-olds staying for one or two weeks at the four-star Le Meridien Chia Laguna Hotel in Sardinia, from May to September (excluding August 6-19). Children must be accompanied by two full-fare paying passengers and bookings must be made by May 15. Once there, youngsters can take advantage of free football and swimming lessons, use of the gym and tennis courts, a golf trial and access to the teenagers' club. sardinia-holidays.co.uk French fancy Restaurant booking service toptable.com has added Paris to its featured cities. Destin-ation Paris lists 50 restaurants including Man Ray, owned by Johnny Depp, Sean Penn and John Malkovich, and a magnet for stars and celebrities; or the two Michelin-starred Michel Rostang. Toptable plans to introduce online booking to other cities, including Barcelona, Madrid and Brussels, later this year. toptable.co.uk/paris Flight of fancy British Airways passengers can now check-in online 24 hours before departure time, and even choose where to sit. The service is available on most routes, and in some cases customers can print off their own boarding cards. ba.com
